findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: EIS - Excessively Integer Size
findings.description: The contract uses a bigger unsigned integer data type than necessary, consuming more storage space and requiring additional computational resources, resulting in higher transaction costs, longer execution times, and potential scalability bottlenecks.

findings.title: RFA - Redundant Fees Accumulation
findings.description: The contract accumulates collected fees in a private variable `tokensForOperations` which is not used meaningfully, increasing gas consumption and decreasing code readability.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RFC - Redundant Fees Calculation
findings.description: The `sellTotalFees` are always equal to the `sellFees.operationsFee`, resulting in the expression `sellFee.operationsFee / sellTotalFees` always equaling 1, which is redundant.

findings.title: RS - Redundant Struct
findings.description: The contract uses two structures, one for buys and one for sales, which contain only one uint256 variable, making them redundant.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. Declaring these variables as immutable can save gas by allowing the Solidity compiler to make certain optimizations.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. It's important to carefully design and implement the events in a contract, and to ensure that all required events are included.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.
